content: This contribution hasn‚Äôt received enough positive votes from the community. The "SHORTEST" option has therefore been deactivated.

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice clash ! Could be done with 2 lines in python :
v = int(input())/12*10000000
print(round(v/sum(20*3.1416*(int(input()))**2 for i in range(4))))

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Simple but not trivial, funny story.
The author fixed all problems with the statement and input/output.

You have a typo in the solution & code generation: "GroundMeetMix" instead of "GroundMeatMix".

I'd suggest changing "Every gate needs the exact count Nuremberg Bratwurst" with a clearer "Every gate needs the exact same count of Nuremberg Bratwurst" because I couldn't understand the constraint at first glance.

The real problem is that there's a bug in the solution though: the final result must NOT be rounded to nearest integer, but truncated (Math.floor instead of Math.round)... which causes many of the expected answers to be off by one.

Once you fix the above points, I'll gladly approve because I found the flavorful trivia very funny ;) and the problem is the right difficulty for a clash üëç especially for the Shortest

(Maybe you can add links to wikipedia for unit conversions and volume of a cylinder, for less-experienced players?)

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It's a well and funny described task, it makes fun to solve and the time effort is roughly 5min.

It's a well written description and it makes fun to solve the task.

But I would say you should make the names of the variables shorter; that was my first step to rename the variables to make them shorter.

1. There is an extra word "Input" in the Input section. It can be removed.
2. In the Constraints section I suggest to change 1.000 to 1000, because some people may interpret the "." as a decimal point rather than a thousand separator.
Thanks.

Gr√º√ü Gott Hans,

I wanted to make clear names, so maybe there are now a little bit long.

But if you use an external editor, I think with a refactoring-option you can quick change that.
It's not a problem with code-completion too. 
Or with Copy'n'Paste.

Do you type varnames manually letter by letter?

Thank you very much!

oh yes, meet vs meat. Shame on me. In the text I have changed it, but I've forgotten the solution and the stub generator. Now I hope all "meet" has gone. :-)
And I changed the Text with you suggestion. Now it is really clearer. You are correct with the "Bug" too. While creating, I thought about it a second, and the next second the thought was away. :-(
Now I added a sentence at the end, hoping it is now correct with "Round":
They make the Bratw√ºrste a few Millimeters shorter or longer, nearly not measurable...  ;-)

The links, I think, are not necessary. Isn't hat part of the basics?

Yes, links are optional :) it would be just for newbies, but it can be part of the challenge.

But they round it to the "closest" integer, rather than the "next" :P

I love You!

English and me - we never will become friends.  (get friends  - would be friends) 
Aaaagggrrrr    :grin:

Servus,

Yeah, I know that auto-completion will avoid this 'bad feature' of long names and I use it as well. However I have the opinion that variable names should be short for all people who don't use this option.

Gr√º√üe gehen raus:)
